title.narrative: EFFECTIVE MANAGEMENT AND DELIVERY OF INTEGRATED SOCIAL PROTECTION SERVICES

description.narrative: Social Protection service providers effectively manage and deliver integrated services that are adjusted to the specific needs of the poorest children., which contributes to Child Poverty / Public Finance For Children, Social Protection. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Evaluations, Research And Data, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: By 2023 the poorest children in Rwanda benefit from a strengthened and adequately-resourced integrated social protection system

participating-org.narrative: MINISTRY OF FINANCE AND ECONOMIC PLANNING MINECOFIN

sector.narrative: Cash Transfers - social protection data management (management information system, social and beneficiary registries, M&E systems)
Cash Transfers: Delivery of cash transfers through government system (beneficiary identification, grievance mechanisms, cash delivery mechanisms like banking, mobiles, community distribution)

Cash Transfers: Technical support to government cash transfer system development and expansion (design, targeting, beneficiary selection, grievance mechanism, cash delivery mechanisms like banking, mobiles, community distribution)
Linking cash to other programs, information and services (information on essential family practices, livelihoods, psycho-social support, etc.)
PF4C: Budget transparency, accountability and participation
Social protection and welfare services policy, planning and administration
Social services (incl youth development and women+ children)
Social welfare workforce strengthening - Case management, referral, capacity development

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: Social Protection service providers effectively manage and deliver integrated services that are adjusted to the specific needs of the poorest children.

description.narrative: The Government of Rwanda has undertaken many transformations in the social protection sector to ensure graduation from and eradication of extreme poverty. This is an important step towards the delivery of ‘cash-plus' programmes for children under five. The first year of a pilot on nutrition sensitive social protection was completed successfully in four districts. The first Joint Programme on integrated social protection in Rwanda was launched successfully with UNICEF as lead agency. | Status:On-track | As-of Date:07/08/2020

# of districts that effectively apply integrated social protection in district-level social policy plans
# of analytical and M&E tools developed to increase adequacy, improve targeting and monitor service delivery
District-level budget monitoring tool developed and used to monitor social sector investment
